text: In vitro suppression of programmed cell death of B cells by <extra_id_0> tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Cellular pathways for induction of programmed cell death ( PCD ) have been identified , but little is known about specific extracellular matrix processes that may affect apoptosis along those pathways .
In this study , a series of Burkitt 's lymphoma ( BL ) cell lines were assayed for their expression of <extra_id_0> tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases (TIMP)-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Results indicate that <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive BL lines show resistance to cold-shock - induced apoptosis .

Furthermore , recombinant <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not <extra_id_0> TIMP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or a synthetic metalloproteinase inhibitor ( BB-94 ) , confers resistance to apoptosis induced by both <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent and - independent ( cold shock , serum deprivation , and gamma-radiation ) pathways in <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative BL lines .

<extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suppression of PCD is not due to metalloproteinase inhibition , as reduction and alkylation of the <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not abolish this activity .

Retroviral induction of <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> not only resulted in cell survival but also in continued DNA synthesis for up to 5 d in the absence of serum , while controls underwent apoptosis .

This resistance to apoptosis is reversed by anti - <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies , demonstrating that secreted <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is active in blocking apoptosis .

Furthermore , <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> upregulation induced expression of <extra_id_0> Bcl-XL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but not <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as decreased NF-kappaB activity as compared with controls .

text: These results demonstrate that <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suppresses apoptosis in B cells and suggests a novel activity for <extra_id_0> TIMP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in tissue homeostasis .
